oai_dc:dc.dc:title: BREAKING LIMIT, BREAKING AND POST-BREAKING WAVE DEFORMATION DUE TO SUBMERGED STRUCTURES
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Iwata, Koichiro
Kawasaki, Koji
Kim, Do-Sam
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: breaking limit
wave deformation
submerged structure
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The aim of this paper is to investigate experimentally and numerically the breaking limit, breaking and post-breaking wave deformation due to three different types of submerged structures such as bottom-seated, non-bottomseated fixed and tautly-moored structures. Based on laboratory experiments, the breaking limits have been formulated for three different types of the submerged structures. Moreover, a modified SOLA-VOF method with the nonreflective wave generation method has been proposed and found to be very effective in evaluating the wave breaking process and post-breaking wave characteristics.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 25 (1996): Proceedings of 25th Conference on Coastal Engineering, Orlando, Florida, 1996.
